metadata.Title: CVE-2022-26387 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When installing an add-on, Firefox verified the signature before prompting the user; but while the user was confirming the prompt, the underlying add-on file could have been modified and Firefox would not have noticed. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 98, Firefox ESR < 91.7, and Thunderbird < 91.7.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26387` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
